result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tevin K Houston

defendant.name: Houston, Tevin K
defendant.address: 6211 West Center Street Apt. 1, Milwaukee, WI 53210

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tevin K Houston appeared by video.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Tevin K Houston.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has received discovery and is waiting on an offer. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Erica N Young appeared in Court on 10/3/2022 informing the Court that she will be assisting a Jury Trial in Branch 15 and requests to reschedule the 10/4/2022 Pretrial Conference. Court grants reschedule of pretrial conference to 11/2/2022 at 2:00 p.m. by ZOOM.

Defendant Tevin K Houston in court.  Attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for State of Wisconsin.   Case back in court.  Defendant has contacted the SPD office and SPD will inform the defendant if he is SPD eligible.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tevin K Houston in court.    Josh Kather, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/19/2022@2:30p
